page.title: 16MANOR FLOODS - ILKESTON
page.content: The area around{Manor Floods}has been an eyesore for many years. The area contained Ilkeston's{rubbish tip,}a {derelict coal mine, old railway lines, {garden allotments}plus the{pond known {as Manor Floods.}But quite recently all that has changed with the{ {Derbyshire County Council Land {Reclamation Scheme.}The whole area has been reshaped. The tip, allotments and railway have given way to{areas of {grassland}newly planted with trees, with{new paths}leading around the pond,a far more attractive picture. The old mine area is being transformed into an{industrial estate}which should be completed by the late 1980's.
